stimulusHtml: A nucleus spontaneously decays, emitting a positron and a neutrino. Did the nucleus undergo alpha decay or beta-plus decay? What evidence or reasoning supports the answer?
choicesHtml: Alpha decay. A neutrino has no electrical charge.
Alpha decay. A positron has the same mass as an electron.
Beta-plus decay. Two nuclei are required products in alpha decay.
Beta-plus decay. A positron and a neutrino are products of beta-plus decay.
